meanings.definition: To intercept and hold (something that has been thrown, propelled, or dropped)
meanings.sent1: The baseball player catches the ball with his glove.
meanings.sent2: She catches the bus every morning to go to work.
meanings.sent3: The cat catches the toy mouse with its paws, thinking it's real.
meanings.sent4: Her smile catches the attention of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web catches unsuspecting insects for its meal.

meanings.definition: To capture or seize, especially after pursuit
meanings.sent1: The police officer catches the thief after a long chase.
meanings.sent2: He catches the fish and proudly shows it to his friends.
meanings.sent3: The little girl catches her mischievous puppy after it escapes.
meanings.sent4: His words catch the essence of the story perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The hunter catches his prey with skill and precision.

meanings.sent1: The kite catches in the tree branches and won't come down.
meanings.sent2: Her hair catches in the brush as she walks through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cat catches its tail and spins in circles trying to free itself.
meanings.sent4: His foot catches on the rug, causing him to stumble.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web catches unsuspecting insects for its meal.

meanings.definition: To attract and hold the attention or interest of
meanings.sent1: The colorful poster catches the eye of passersby.
meanings.sent2: Her story catches the imagination of the children listening.
meanings.sent3: The catchy tune catches in your head and you can't stop humming it.
meanings.sent4: The movie's plot twist catches the audience by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city catch your attention from miles away.
